newsitem.title: NORWAY: Aker RGI U.S. unit delisted from NASDAQ.
newsitem.headline: Aker RGI U.S. unit delisted from NASDAQ.

text.p: Norwegian holding company Aker RGI ASA said on Friday its U.S.-based real estate subsidiary Legend Properties, had been delisted from the Small Cap Market of the NASDAQ exchange.
The delisting comes after Legend was unable to provide an independent auditor's opinion on its year-end results because of uncertainties surrounding a class action legal suit.
NASDAQ regulations require an independent auditor's opinion.

On July 24 a Delaware court rejected a settlement in the suit, brought against Banyan Mortgage Investment Fund, which was bought by RGI U.S. Holdings in December, 1996. The new firm was named Legend Properties.
The suit claims Banyan's board did not properly review options before agreeing to the buyout and sought greater value for shareholders.
The court rejected the settlement because it did not believe the named plaintiffs were adequate class representatives, Legend said in a statement following the judgement.
Aker RGI holds an 80 percent stake in RGI Holdings, which in turn owns 79.7 percent of Legend Properties.
